channel.title: Observability of Dubbo on Apache Dubbo
channel.description: Recent content in Observability of Dubbo on Apache Dubbo

item.title: Meter
item.description: overview 1. Indicator access instructions 2. Indicator system design Dubbo’s indicator system involves three parts in total, indicator collection, local aggregation, and indicator push Indicator collection: Push the indicators that need to be monitored inside Dubbo to a unified Collector for storage Local Aggregation: All indicators collected are basic indicators, and some quantile indicators need to be calculated through local aggregation Indicator push: The collected and aggregated indicators are pushed to third-party servers in a certain way, currently only involving Prometheus

item.title: Tracing
item.description: Overview Apache Dubbo has inbuilt tracing through Micrometer Observations and Micrometer Tracing. 1. Adding Micrometer Observation To Your Project In order to add Micrometer to the classpath and add metrics for Dubbo you need to add the dubbo-metrics-api dependency as shown below: <dependency> <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId> <artifactId>dubbo-metrics-api</artifactId> </dependency> Thanks to the usage of Micrometer Observations Dubbo got instrumented once, but depending on the setup will allow emission of metrics, tracer or other signals via custom ObservationHandlers.
